tool.name: Create lookup DB with sequences
tool.command: msslookup seqspace -i '$input' #if $insourcefrag --insourcefrag #end if #if $enzyme.trypsinize == "false" --notrypsin #else if $enzyme.proline == "true" --cutproline #end if && mv mslookup_db.sqlite '$output'

param.name: input
param.label: FASTA database
param.help: Contains the protein sequences that will be used to create the lookup table

param.name: insourcefrag
param.label: Use in-source fragmentation option when filtering?
param.help: Reverses sequences so database can assess with wildcards to detect insource fragmentation

param.name: proline
param.label: Trypsin cuts before a proline residue
param.help: When enabled this includes peptides from when trypsin cuts before proline, as well as those not cut before proline

tool.help: Creates from a FASTA sequence file tryptic sequences that are stored in the output file which is an SQLite database. The output can be used to do lookups on to find wether a sequence was found in the FASTA file.
